intro: Lisianthius splendens, commonly known as the showy lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
